channel.title: GetAsyncKeyState equivalent?
channel.description: Simple question, google gave me mixed results, so, is there an equivalent to GetAsyncKeyState in Java? If not, are there any packages that would provide such an option?

item.title: GetAsyncKeyState equivalent?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Coder xynt, post:1, topic:238493”]I’ve been looking around, for how it would be possible to make such a thing (Java KeyLogger) and it turns out to be quite impossible. Because this is what keeps Java from being platform-dependant.[/quote]orly?

Please, don’t post bullshit which you don’t understand.

Read full topic

item.title: GetAsyncKeyState equivalent?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:6, topic:238422”]There is no possible way in java (except trough jni) to get the state of a key, which is not being pressed on your application.
Otherwise implement a KeyListener to the components where you want to catch the key.[/quote]

that guy who made the java keylogger, did he use JNI? i was not as expirienced in java when he had posted that, and now i cannot get the source :o

Read full topic

item.title: GetAsyncKeyState equivalent?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

There is no possible way in java (except trough jni) to get the state of a key, which is not being pressed on your application.
Otherwise implement a KeyListener to the components where you want to catch the key.

Read full topic

item.title: GetAsyncKeyState equivalent?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

key listener requires your app to be focused, or not necessarily your app, some guy did an application which attaches to any running applet and gives you keys pressed, like some sort of java keylogger.

try JNI, heres a quick exampel i just made while writing this post :

KeyInfo.java

public class KeyInfo
{
	static
	{
		System.loadLibrary("Log");
	}

	public static native boolean getAsyncKeyState(int i);

	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		while (!getAsyncKeyState(65))
		{
		}

		System.out.println("Done.");
	}
}

Log.c

#include <stdio.h>
#include <windows.h>
#include "KeyInfo.h"

JNIEXPORT jboolean JNICALL Java_KeyInfo_getAsyncKeyState(JNIEnv *e, jclass cls, jint arg)
{
	return GetAsyncKeyState(arg) != 0 ? JNI_TRUE : JNI_FALSE;
}

KeyInfo.h (used javah.exe)

/* DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE - it is machine generated */
#include <jni.h>
/* Header for class KeyInfo */

#ifndef _Included_KeyInfo
#define _Included_KeyInfo
#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif
/*
 * Class:     KeyInfo
 * Method:    getAsyncKeyState
 * Signature: (I)Z
 */
JNIEXPORT jboolean JNICALL Java_KeyInfo_getAsyncKeyState
  (JNIEnv *, jclass, jint);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif
#endif

down = true, up = false;

Read full topic
